Description: The Department of Justice announced that it  reached settlements with 51 hospitals in 15 states for more than $23 million related to cardiac devices that were implanted in Medicare patients in violation of Medicare coverage requirements.

Fifty-five hospitals in 21 states agreed to pay the United States a total of more than $34 million to settle allegations that they submitted false claims to Medicare for kyphoplasty, a minimally-invasive procedure used to treat certain spinal fractures that often are due to osteoporosis.

Seven hospitals located around the country agreed to pay the United States a total of $5,476,637 to settle claims that they unlawfully charged federal health care programs for surgical procedures using unapproved experimental cardiac devices.

Company: Mount Sinai Medical Center of Florida, Inc.
Info Source: MOUNT SINAI MEDICAL CENTER ENTERS SETTLEMENT ON FALSE CLAIMS ACT ALLEGATIONS FOR $3.49 MILLION, US Fed News, August 10, 2006 (via Nexis).
